bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names wu ge qi 五膈氣 , five types of occlusion qi. Pathological Condition referring to five types of occlusion, each resulting from different causes: you ge 憂膈 , occlusion by grief; hui ge 恚膈 , occlusion by rage; qi ge 氣膈 , occlusion by qi; han ge 寒膈 , occlusion by cold; re ge 熱膈 , occlusion by heat. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 13: 眾 方說五膈，互有不同，但傷動之由有五，故云五膈氣 , “All recipes speak of ‘ five types of occlusion ’. They resemble each other, but they have five different causes. Hence one speaks of the ‘five occlusion qi ’”.
